meanings.sent1: The little bird built a globate nest in the tree.
meanings.sent2: The globate moon shone brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The globate balloon floated gracefully in the air.
meanings.sent4: Her globate laughter filled the room with joy.
meanings.sent5: The globate orange rolled off the table and onto the floor.

meanings.definition: To make or become round or spherical.
meanings.sent1: She carefully globated the dough into perfect little balls.
meanings.sent2: The potter globated the clay into a beautiful vase.
meanings.sent3: The chef globated the meat into bite-sized portions.
meanings.sent4: The artist globated the paint on the canvas to create a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The children globated the snow into a snowman in the yard.
